intro: Spiesia tschujae, commonly known as the Tschuja spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a perennial shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan. The plant is characterized by its smooth, often reddish stems and small, clustered yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a distinctive, slightly lobed shape. Spiesia tschujae is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resistance to drought and poor soil conditions.
